remarks: A ring homomorphism is injective if and only if its kernel is zero. (Contributed by Jeff Madsen, 16-Jun-2011.)
statement:
rngkerinj.1 $e |- G = ( 1st ` R ) $.
rngkerinj.2 $e |- X = ran G $.
rngkerinj.3 $e |- W = ( GId ` G ) $.
rngkerinj.4 $e |- J = ( 1st ` S ) $.
rngkerinj.5 $e |- Y = ran J $.
rngkerinj.6 $e |- Z = ( GId ` J ) $.
rngokerinj $p |- ( ( R e. RingOps /\ S e. RingOps /\ F e. ( R RngHom S ) ) -> ( F : X -1-1-> Y <-> ( `' F " { Z } ) = { W } ) ) $.
